page.title: 17DOGMERSFIELD PARK AND LAKE
page.content: To the west of Broad Oak lies the Dogmersfield Park and Lake. The area is a dense woodland with mature deciduous trees. A minor road, off the A287, Farnham road, goes through the parkland to Dogmersfield Village. The entrance to the Park is near the newly erected Amdahl House. It is built on the site of the old Dogmersfield House which was destroyed by fire. Amdahl House is the European headquarters of an American-owned company which manufactures electrical goods. Part of the area, including the lake, belongs to the company. There is a boat-house near the lake and a weir on the lake. There are two parish churches in the area and a small number of houses. The Alder Valley bus service passes along the A287, Farnham road, to Basingstoke and Farnham via Hook railway station.{
